title: Textile, ca. 1924
medium:
Medium: mercerized cotton? weft: viscose rayon
Technique: compound satin weave
description: Length of woven silk with a brown ground and a bold pattern of orange flames and swirling gold clouds of rising smoke forming paisley-like forms; salamanders move among the flames. Le Feu is one of a series of silks representing the four elements (earth, air, fire and water) exhibited at the Exposition Internationale des Arts Decoratifs, Paris, 1925.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1924.
ca. 1924. Medium: mercerized cotton? weft: viscose rayon
